messages.message: Did anyone change anything that could affect the advanced-apps test recently? It's failing across PRs because it can't find the create button
Not sure how/why it changed, but the issue was that the user didn't have the right permissions in crafting-cyp. Just fixed it, hopefully the next runs pass
i was just going to ask about this too, thanks for fixing!

@Travis I gave the user mange AI Hub and write to file system permissions, and the create button shows up, but the app fails to be created. The test mentions that it needs manage marketplace permissions, but I actually don't see that one anymore. I gave it manage AI Hub and write to file system permissions but apparently that's not enough
Do you know what other permissions I need to give it
Or @Weiming Wu
I saw that failure in my PR as well, but then I logged in with the user for the test and it showed the button...
Yes, I fixed the button showing, but now the app isn't created successfully
Those should be the two permissions though... :thinking_face:
Hmm, the only info we have is that the status of the request was "Adding to database" and "Failed to create app". I'll ask the backend team to help debug

I just tried creating an advanced app with <mailto:support-testing+org-admin@instabase.com|support-testing+org-admin@instabase.com> and that worked
Is there a permission that the org admin user has that the enterprise admin user doesn't?
Not as far as I can tell, they have the same permissions in the admin app. Maybe it was transient, I'm trying to run my PR again
I'm running it manually as the enterprise user and it's still failing :confused:
The test description says it needs "manage marketplace" permissions, is there something we're missing with that? It's not on the site permissions list anymore
@Weiming Wu the cypress test logs in as <mailto:support-testing+org-admin-e@instabase.com|support-testing+org-admin-e@instabase.com> (note the `-e` at the end)
@Serena Yes, that one still fails. Creating with <mailto:support-testing+org-admin@instabase.com|support-testing+org-admin@instabase.com> works though
So it's unique to the account, not the backend
Asked in another channel here: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C03UZR5P1S6/p1726181548153069

btw the marketplace admin permission is under “App permissions”

it seems that <mailto:support-testing+org-admin-e@instabase.com|support-testing+org-admin-e@instabase.com> does have that permission though
Ah I found it - it was the Marketplace Admin one
I just added the account to it and tested it
ah i see, that would make sense then
Ahh thank you! I was looking at the site permissions page and missed that one. Maybe we should update the permissions of the create button to look for all of the relevant permissions
I'll do that as part of a PR I'm working on to fix version history. Also, is write to file system required for advanced apps?
I believe so - we have to upload the .ibflow file and an icon file to a staging folder
